section.name: Deployment Plans
section.p: A deployment plan is an XML document referenced as an artificat that defines the configuration of a station instance. The plan datatype declares a root <plan> element which contains zero or more <entry> elements where each entry associates a key with a codebase uri. A plan is referenced as an artifact using the station command line tool.

section.name: Examples
section.p: The following example plan includes three deployment entries. The first two entries reference appliance datatypes which trigger the establishment of the respective applications in their own JVMs. The third entry is a part datatype to be loaded into the current virtual machine.
section.source:
<plan xmlns="dpml:station" name="demo" title="Plan Demo">
<entry key="foo" uri="link:appliance:dpml/metro/demo-foo"/> <entry key="bar" uri="link:appliance:dpml/metro/demo-bar"/> <entry key="toto" uri="link:part:dpml/metro/dpml-metro-sample?message=Hello%20World&port=1024"/>
</plan>
